subject: History
title: Zheng He's Treasure Fleet
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Zheng He's Treasure Fleet.

hook.text: In 1405, China launched the largest fleet the world had ever seenâ€”decades before Columbus was born.

buildup.text: Admiral Zheng He commanded 300 ships and 28,000 men. His flagship was five times larger than Columbus's.

discovery.text: The fleet reached East Africa, the Persian Gulf, and Southeast Asia, spreading diplomacy and trade.

twist.text: After Zheng He died, China's new emperor banned ocean voyages. The fleet was scrapped. Records were burned.

climax.text: If China hadn't turned inward, European exploration might have met Chinese ships rounding Africa first.

punchline.text: China explored the world, then chose to forget it.

quiz.question: What happened to China's exploration program after Zheng He?
options: The emperor banned ocean voyages and scrapped the fleet
It was taken over by Japanese admirals
